blogs.body:
Rasgulla, also known as Rosogolla, is a popular dessert originating from India and Bangladesh. This delicious treat consists of small, spongy balls made from chhena (cottage cheese) dough, which are then cooked in light syrup. In this blog post, we will guide you through the process of preparing rasgulla at home.
Ingredients:
1 kg chenna (cottage cheese)
1 cup powdered sugar
1 tsp cardamom powder
1 tbsp cornflour
2 cups water
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
Few strands of saffron
1 tsp rosewater
Instructions:
Prepare the chhena mixture: Grate the cottage cheese using a fine grater and transfer it to a bowl. Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and cornflour to the bowl. Mix everything well until the dough forms a smooth consistency. Cover the dough and let it rest for about 30 minutes.
Shape the rasgullas: Divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into small balls. You should get around 25-30 rasgullas depending on the size.
Boil the syrup: Combine water, sugar, and a few strands of saffron in a wide pan. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once the syrup reaches a thick consistency, remove it from the heat.
Cook the rasgullas: Gently drop the shaped rasgullas into the hot syrup. Let them cook for about 20-25 minutes on low heat. Do not stir the syrup during this time, as it may break the rasgullas. After cooking, turn off the heat and add rosewater to the syrup. Allow the rasgullas to soak in the syrup for at least 3 hours before serving.
Tips:
Make sure the chhena mixture is smooth and free of lumps before shaping the rasgullas.
Use a wide pan when making the syrup to ensure even heating and prevent burning.
Be patient while cooking the rasgullas in the syrup, as they need time to absorb the flavors and become soft.
Store leftover rasgulla in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
With these simple steps, you can now enjoy the sweet delight of rasgulla at home!
